titleInfo.title: 156BN74 Cherry, Benton County, Tennessee. Burials 84BN34, 35, 36, 37, 38 and 39. Burial 34 - adult female, fully flexed, head SW, on left side. Burial 35 - indeterminate child, head north, on left side. Burial 36 - indeterminate infant, head north, face east. Burial 37 - adult male, head south. Burial 38 - adult female, fragmentary. Burial 39 - indeterminate juvenile(?), partly flexed, head NE. Square 20R15. Direction Southeast

mods.abstract: [84BN34] Adult female in fair condition, fully flexed on left side with head oriented to SW. Fair - maybe old juvenile, one of the pile, This group of 6 burials; 2 adult females (one possibly juvenile), 1 juvenile, 1 child, 1 infant, 1 adult male, may have been one family. Perhaps some crime, tragedy of disease or war caused their deaths to be coincident and their burial the same. [84BN35] Indeterminate chile in fair condition, partly flexed on left side with head oriented north. Lower body cut away by pit (10) in test trench. [84BN36] Indeterminate infant in poor condition, probably partly flexed on left side with head oriented north. One of the last thrown on. [84BN37] Adult male in good condition, partly flexed on back and left, head oriented to south. One bag, cut in two by pit (10). See projectile point in head of left femur. [84BN38] Adult female in fair condition, partly flexed on back and left, head oriented to south. One bag. [84BN39] Indeterminate juvenile in fair condition, partly flexed on right side with head oriented to NE. One of first thrown in. These burials were probably in a scooped depression, in the midden. No regular pit.
mods.note: Institution has illustrations of burials on file.
